title: Gnome (monster class)
data:
The **gnome** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the uppercase [G](/wiki/G "G") glyph (G). Gnomes are designated internally by the macro `S_GNOME`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The monster class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- G [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster\) "Gnome (monster)")
- G [gnome lord](/wiki/Gnome_lord "Gnome lord")
- G [gnomish wizard](/wiki/Gnomish_wizard "Gnomish wizard")
- G [gnome king](/wiki/Gnome_king "Gnome king")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)

  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [1.2 Starting inventory](#Starting_inventory)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [4.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.5 GnollHack](#GnollHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Common traits

Gnomes are [small](/wiki/Small "Small"), [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous") [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") monsters that have [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and can be seen with infravision. Naturally, all monsters in the monster class have the [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_attribute\) "Gnome (monster attribute)") [monster attribute](/wiki/Monster_attribute "Monster attribute").

Hostile gnomes will collect items that they are capable of using, such as [weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon"), [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") and [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand").

### Generation

Randomly generated monsters from the gnome monster class are always peaceful towards [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") and [dwarvish](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") [heroes](/wiki/Hero "Hero"), and will be hostile towards heroes of other races.

Several monsters from the gnome class are generated within the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") at level creation, including the following instances of random gnomes:

- Two random G are generated on each of the filler levels for the Mines.

- Many are generated in most maps of [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown"):

  - One G is generated in an ordinary room on the Alley Town and College Town maps.
  - One G is generated in the room to the west of [Izchak](/wiki/Izchak "Izchak")'s shop in Grotto Town, and another occupies the northern room between the temple and downstair.
  - An ordinary room on the Bazaar Town map has a 3⁄4 chance of containing a G.

- For a dwarvish or gnomish character, two-thirds of the gnomes and other peaceful monsters will instead be replaced with random monsters.

Gnomes may appear among the hostile monsters that generate in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room"), as well the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a throne while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

### Starting inventory

All monsters in the monster class are eligible for [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"), and [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item").

A gnome placed at level creation has a chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a single [candle](/wiki/Candle "Candle"): the chance is 1⁄20 if they are in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"), and 1⁄60 otherwise.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) The candle has a 3⁄4 chance of being tallow and a 1⁄4 chance of being wax, and will be lit if the gnome is generated in a dark area.

Gnomes with weapon attacks that are not generated on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level") have a chance of being generated with one of the five default weapon sets: 3-14 [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), a [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow") and 3-14 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt"), a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow") and 3-14 [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow"), a stack of 3-5 [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), or an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys").[\[5\]](#cite_note-default-5) The chance is 5⁄14 for standard gnomes, 5⁄12 for gnome lords, and 1⁄2 for gnome kings.

## Strategy

Gnomes appear in large numbers in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") and are mostly slower than an unburdened character, but are still a frequent cause of death for the incautious and low-leveled, especially if they pick up certain wands and tools.

## History

The gnome first appears in Hack for PDP-11, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial bestiary for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0") - the other gnome monsters first appear in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds several monsters to the monster class, including the [gnolls](/wiki/Gnoll "Gnoll"):

- G [gnome warrior](/wiki/Gnome_warrior "Gnome warrior")
- G [gnome thief](/wiki/Gnome_thief "Gnome thief")
- G [deep gnome](/wiki/Deep_gnome "Deep gnome")
- G [Ruggo the Gnome King](/wiki/Ruggo_the_Gnome_King "Ruggo the Gnome King")
- G [gnoll](/wiki/Gnoll "Gnoll")
- G [gnoll warrior](/wiki/Gnoll_warrior "Gnoll warrior")
- G [gnoll chieftain](/wiki/Gnoll_chieftain "Gnoll chieftain")
- G [gnoll shaman](/wiki/Gnoll_shaman "Gnoll shaman")

For gnomish and dwarvish characters, the normally peaceful gnomes and other friendly monsters in the Mines are mostly replaced with hostile undead, with the following substitutions made for gnomish monsters generated at level creation:[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

- G Gnomes become Z [gnome zombies](/wiki/Gnome_zombie "Gnome zombie")
- G Gnomish wizards become o [orc shamans](/wiki/Orc_shaman "Orc shaman")
- G Gnome lords become M [gnome mummies](/wiki/Gnome_mummies "Gnome mummies")
- G Gnome kings become O [ogres](/wiki/Ogre "Ogre")

Note that these substitutions only affect monsters *explicitly* specified as part of level generation - if a random G is called for, that monster will be generated as normal, even if the monster chosen is one of the above monsters. Some of the substitutions are also quite rare:

- Two gnomish wizards are generated in all variants of Minetown, as well as in The Gnome King's Wine Cellar variant of Mines' End. These wizards will be replaced with orc shamans, but otherwise this substitution will not be seen.
- A gnome king is found in the Bazaar Town map of Minetown and The Gnome King's Wine Cellar and The Mimic of the Mines variants of Mines' End. These will be replaced with ogres, but the substitution is otherwise unused.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), gnomes are an eligible race for the various [racial monsters](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") that appear in the dungeon: gnomish wizards are replaced by [mages](/wiki/Mage_\(GruntHack\) "Mage (GruntHack)"), while gnome lords are replaced by [lords and ladies](/wiki/Lord_\(GruntHack\) "Lord (GruntHack)"), and gnome kings are replaced by [kings and queens](/wiki/King_\(GruntHack\) "King (GruntHack)").

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack") expand the monster class to include [gizmos](/wiki/Gizmo "Gizmo"): Gizmos are nonliving machine monsters that share the same glyph, but are not considered gnomish monsters and typically do not share traits with them (though some gnomes can create gizmo monsters). dNetHack and its variants add several other new monsters to the monster class as well:

- G [clockwork soldier](/wiki/Clockwork_soldier "Clockwork soldier")
- G [clockwork dwarf](/wiki/Clockwork_dwarf "Clockwork dwarf")
- G [faberge sphere](/wiki/Faberge_sphere "Faberge sphere")
- G [firework cart](/wiki/Firework_cart "Firework cart")
- G [gnome lady](/wiki/Gnome_lady_\(dNetHack\) "Gnome lady (dNetHack)")
- G [tinker gnome](/wiki/Tinker_gnome "Tinker gnome")
- G [gnome queen](/wiki/Gnome_queen_\(dNetHack\) "Gnome queen (dNetHack)")
- G [clockwork factory](/wiki/Clockwork_factory "Clockwork factory")
- G [golden heart](/wiki/Golden_heart "Golden heart")
- G [juggernaut](/wiki/Juggernaut "Juggernaut")
- G [id juggernaut](/wiki/Id_juggernaut "Id juggernaut")
- G [scrap titan](/wiki/Scrap_titan "Scrap titan")
- G [hellfire colossus](/wiki/Hellfire_colossus "Hellfire colossus")
- G [hellfire orb](/wiki/Hellfire_orb "Hellfire orb")
- G [clockwork automaton](/wiki/Clockwork_automaton "Clockwork automaton")
- G [colossal clockwork war-machine](/index.php?title=Colossal_clockwork_war-machine\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Colossal clockwork war-machine (page does not exist)")
- G [Ruggo the Gnome High King](/index.php?title=Ruggo_the_Gnome_High_King\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ruggo the Gnome High King (page does not exist)")
- G [parasitized android](/index.php?title=Parasitized_android\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitized android (page does not exist)")
- G [parasitized gynoid](/index.php?title=Parasitized_gynoid\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitized gynoid (page does not exist)")
- G [parasitized operator](/index.php?title=Parasitized_operator\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitized operator (page does not exist)")
- G [parasitized commander](/index.php?title=Parasitized_commander\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitized commander (page does not exist)")
- G [crucified android](/index.php?title=Crucified_android\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Crucified android (page does not exist)")
- G [crucified gynoid](/index.php?title=Crucified_gynoid\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Crucified gynoid (page does not exist)")
- G [android](/wiki/Android "Android")
- G [gynoid](/index.php?title=Gynoid\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gynoid (page does not exist)")
- G [operator](/index.php?title=Operator\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Operator (page does not exist)")
- G [commander](/index.php?title=Commander\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Commander (page does not exist)")
- G [gnome comrade](/wiki/Gnome_comrade "Gnome comrade")

The gnome lady and gnome queen are separate monsters from gnome lords and kings, rather than female versions of gnome lords and gnome kings.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") does not add any new monsters to the gnome monster class, but gives gnolls [their own monster class](/wiki/Gnoll_\(SpliceHack\) "Gnoll (SpliceHack)") and accompanying glyph, 9, rather than making them a part of the gnome monster class as in SLASH'EM and some other variants.

### GnollHack

In [GnollHack](/wiki/GnollHack "GnollHack"), the gnome monster class is merged into the [gremlin monster class](/wiki/Gremlin_\(monster_class\) "Gremlin (monster class)") to make room for the [gnoll monster class](/index.php?title=Gnoll_\(GnollHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gnoll (GnollHack) (page does not exist)"), which occupies their former glyph at G.

## Encyclopedia entry

... And then a gnome came by, carrying a bundle, an old fellow three times as large as an imp and wearing clothes of a sort, especially a hat. And he was clearly just as frightened as the imps though he could not go so fast. Ramon Alonzo saw that there must be some great trouble that was vexing magical things; and, since gnomes speak the language of men, and will answer if spoken to gently, he raised his hat, and asked of the gnome his name. The gnome did not stop his hasty shuffle a moment as he answered 'Alaraba' and grabbed the rim of his hat but forgot to doff it.  
'What is the trouble, Alaraba?' said Ramon Alonzo.  
'White magic. Run!' said the gnome ..  
                        \[ The Charwoman's Shadow, by Lord Dunsany ]  
   
"Muggles have garden gnomes, too, you know," Harry told Ron as they crossed the lawn.  
"Yeah, I've seen those things they think are gnomes," said Ron, bent double with his head in a peony bush, "like fat little Santa Clauses with fishing rods..."  
There was a violent scuffling noise, the peony bush shuddered, and Ron straightened up. "This is a gnome," he said grimly.  
"Geroff me! Gerroff me!" squealed the gnome.  
It was certainly nothing like Santa Claus. It was small and leathery looking, with a large, knobby, bald head exactly like a potato. Ron held it at arm's length as it kicked out at him with its horny little feet; he grasped it around the ankles and turned it upside down.

\[ Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, by J. K. Rowling ]

Gnome (monster class)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The gnome is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the uppercase G glyph (G). Gnomes are designated internally by the macro S_GNOME.[1]

The monster class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • G gnome
  • G gnome lord
  • G gnomish wizard
  • G gnome king

Common traits

Gnomes are small, omnivorous humanoid monsters that have infravision and can be seen with infravision. Naturally, all monsters in the monster class have the gnome monster attribute.

Hostile gnomes will collect items that they are capable of using, such as weapons, armor and wands.

Randomly generated monsters from the gnome monster class are always peaceful towards gnomish and dwarvish heroes, and will be hostile towards heroes of other races.

Several monsters from the gnome class are generated within the Gnomish Mines at level creation, including the following instances of random gnomes:

  • Two random G are generated on each of the filler levels for the Mines.
  • Many are generated in most maps of Minetown:
    • One G is generated in an ordinary room on the Alley Town and College Town maps.
    • One G is generated in the room to the west of Izchak's shop in Grotto Town, and another occupies the northern room between the temple and downstair.
    • An ordinary room on the Bazaar Town map has a 3⁄4 chance of containing a G.
  • For a dwarvish or gnomish character, two-thirds of the gnomes and other peaceful monsters will instead be replaced with random monsters.

Gnomes may appear among the hostile monsters that generate in throne rooms, as well the monsters randomly generated by looting a throne while confused and carrying gold (provided there is no chest on the level).[3]

All monsters in the monster class are eligible for offensive items, defensive items, and miscellaneous items.

A gnome placed at level creation has a chance of being generated with a single candle: the chance is 1⁄20 if they are in the Gnomish Mines, and 1⁄60 otherwise.[4] The candle has a 3⁄4 chance of being tallow and a 1⁄4 chance of being wax, and will be lit if the gnome is generated in a dark area.

Gnomes appear in large numbers in the Gnomish Mines and are mostly slower than an unburdened character, but are still a frequent cause of death for the incautious and low-leveled, especially if they pick up certain wands and tools.

History

The gnome first appears in Hack for PDP-11, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial bestiary for Hack 1.0 - the other gnome monsters first appear in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds several monsters to the monster class, including the gnolls:

  • G gnome warrior
  • G gnome thief
  • G deep gnome
  • G Ruggo the Gnome King
  • G gnoll
  • G gnoll warrior
  • G gnoll chieftain
  • G gnoll shaman

For gnomish and dwarvish characters, the normally peaceful gnomes and other friendly monsters in the Mines are mostly replaced with hostile undead, with the following substitutions made for gnomish monsters generated at level creation:[6]

  • G Gnomes become Z gnome zombies
  • G Gnomish wizards become o orc shamans
  • G Gnome lords become M gnome mummies

In GruntHack, gnomes are an eligible race for the various racial monsters that appear in the dungeon: gnomish wizards are replaced by mages, while gnome lords are replaced by lords and ladies, and gnome kings are replaced by kings and queens.

  • G clockwork soldier

Gnomes with weapon attacks that are not generated on the [[Rogue level]] have a chance of being generated with one of the five default weapon sets: 3-14 [[dart]]s, a [[crossbow]] and 3-14 [[crossbow bolt]]s, a [[bow]] and 3-14 [[arrow]]s, a stack of 3-5 [[dagger]]s, or an [[aklys]].{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|512|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name="default"|comment=Default set of cases for monster weapon generation}} The chance is {{frac|5|14}} for standard gnomes, {{frac|5|12}} for gnome lords, and {{frac|2}} for gnome kings. ==Strategy== Gnomes appear in large numbers in the [[Gnomish Mines]] and are mostly slower than an unburdened character, but are still a frequent cause of death for the incautious and low-leveled, especially if they pick up certain wands and tools. ==History== The gnome first appears in Hack for PDP-11, a variant of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial bestiary for [[Hack 1.0]] - the other gnome monsters first appear in [[NetHack 3.0.0]]. ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== [[SLASH'EM]] adds several monsters to the monster class, including the [[gnoll]]s: * {{monsymlink|gnome warrior}} * {{monsymlink|gnome thief}} * {{monsymlink|deep gnome}} * {{monsymlink|Ruggo the Gnome King}} * {{gray|G}} [[gnoll]] * {{white|G}} [[gnoll warrior]] * {{magenta|G}} [[gnoll chieftain]] * {{yellow|G}} [[gnoll shaman]] For gnomish and dwarvish characters, the normally peaceful gnomes and other friendly monsters in the Mines are mostly replaced with hostile undead, with the following substitutions made for gnomish monsters generated at level creation:{{refsrc|sp_lev.c|854|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} * {{monsym|Gnome}} Gnomes become {{monsym|Gnome zombie}} [[gnome zombie]]s * {{monsym|Gnomish wizard}} Gnomish wizards become {{monsym|orc shaman}} [[orc shaman]]s * {{monsym|Gnome lord}} Gnome lords become {{monsym|Gnome mummy}} [[gnome mummies]] * {{monsym|Gnome king}} Gnome kings become {{monsym|ogre}} [[ogre]]s Note that these substitutions only affect monsters ''explicitly'' specified as part of level generation - if a random {{white|G}} is called for, that monster will be generated as normal, even if the monster chosen is one of the above monsters. Some of the substitutions are also quite rare: * Two gnomish wizards are generated in all variants of Minetown, as well as in The Gnome King's Wine Cellar variant of Mines' End. These wizards will be replaced with orc shamans, but otherwise this substitution will not be seen. * A gnome king is found in the Bazaar Town map of Minetown and The Gnome King's Wine Cellar and The Mimic of the Mines variants of Mines' End. These will be replaced with ogres, but the substitution is otherwise unused. ===GruntHack=== In [[GruntHack]], gnomes are an eligible race for the various [[racial monster]]s that appear in the
